intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium pietroszense subsp. jarzabczynum, commonly known as the Jarzabczynski's Hawkweed, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and genetic differences from other members of the *Hieracium* genus. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
